page.title: 17FIGHELDEAN PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: { Figheldean School was built in 1858 in typical{Victorian style.}In recent years{three temporary wooden class- {rooms}have been erected. It is a {Church of England controlled school. In{1985}it is a{three teacher school for pupils{aged 5-11 years with 59 on {roll. Mrs.B.Carter is Headteacher. { At 11 years}the pupils{transfer}to {Durrington Comprehensive School}to continue their education. The pupils come from both the {Airfield Camp and the village of {Figheldean.}This means that a percentage of pupils move away from the area at regular intervals. { The curriculum is very varied}and includes{residential courses in Wales, opportunities to learn{musical {instruments, cooking with gas and {electricity, computers, clubs and {games and regular use of the community
